de.z1up.blockchain

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.z1up.blockchain.Block

  • public class Block
extends java.lang.Object
    A Block is an Object, which will be stored in a Blockchain. Blocks should always be final, since their values aren't supposed to change anymore after the block is generated.
    See Also:
    Blockchain

    • Method Detail

      • mine

        public Block mine()
        The mine() method mines a Block. Mining a Block means, that a hash value is generated from the content, timestamp, previous hash and the nonce using the SHA256. The method returns the current Block, but with a set hash value.
        Returns:
        The final, mined Block

      • getHash

        public java.lang.String getHash()
        Returns the generated Hash for the given Block. Returns an empty String if the hash is null.
        Returns:
        the current Hash

      • setHash

        public void setHash(java.lang.String hash)
        Sets the current Hash value.
        Parameters:
        hash - The new hash value

      • getContent

        public java.lang.String[] getContent()
        Returns the current content stored in the given block.
        Returns:
        The content

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        Returns the timestamp which indicates when the block was created.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the block

      • getPrevHash

        public java.lang.String getPrevHash()
        Returns the Hash value of the previous Block in the Blockchain. Important: Value might not match with the actual previous Hash from the Blockchain, since the value is set manually.
        Returns:
        The previous Hash

      • setPrevHash

        public void setPrevHash(java.lang.String prevHash)
        Stores the hash value of the previous Block in the Blockchain.
        Parameters:
        prevHash - The previous hash value

      • getNonce

        public int getNonce()
        Returns the current nonce value.
        Returns:
        Current nonce.

      • setNonce

        public void setNonce(int nonce)
        Assigns a new value to the nonce variable.
        Parameters:
        nonce - The new nonce value.
